description: From Middle English tried, tryed, equivalent to try +â€Ž -ed.

adjectives.description: tried (comparative more tried, superlative most tried)

entries.meaning: Tested, hence, proven to be firm or reliable.
(law) Put on trial, taken before a lawcourt.
simple past tense and past participle of try
examples: The boy became volubly friendly and bubbling over with unexpected humour and high spirits. He tried to persuade Cicely to stay away from the ball-room for a fourth dance. Nobody would miss them, he explained.
